decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The outdoor seating area to which this permission relates shall not open to customers outside of the following hours:11:00 to 23:00 Monday to Friday11:00 to 23:00 on Saturdays11:00 to 22:00 on Sundays and bank holidaysReason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Internal lighting within the outdoor seating structure hereby permitted shall be turned off within one hour of the closure of the associated restuarant use. Reason: To preserve the significance of designated heritage assets, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Within 2 months of this permission, details of a replacement timber fence on the south western boundary of the site (adjacent to St Peter's Church) shall have be submitted for written approval of the Local Planning Authority. The new fencing shall have no gaps between the slats and be flush with the top of the existing brick wall.The fence shall be implemented in accordance with approved details within 2 months of approval and maintained thereafter to a reasonable standard. Reason: To preserve the significance of designated heritage assets, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No amplified sound system shall be installed and made operational until the details of a suitably calibrated noise limiter so as to prevent the transmission of noise and vibration into any neighbouring premises has been submitted to and agreed in writing by the local planning authority. This noise limiter shall be implemented and maintained in accordance with manufacturer's instructions.Reason: To ensure that the reasonable residential amenities of adjoining properties are adequately protected from noise pollution.
description: Retrospective application for outdoor seating area to the side and front of the building

phasing_details.phase_detail: Installation of Ducting and canopy system
